p: Works of Takahasi et al. report the isolation of 1,4-benzodioxane derivatives from the MeOH extract of the seeds of Japanese specimens and their neuritogenic activity in primary cultured rat cortical neurons, suggesting their role as potential candidates for nonpeptide neurotrophic agents ( Figure 6) [ 44, 45, 46]. The saponins esculentoside B and esculentside S were also isolated [ 46].
